poem:
### Coalition at Dawn

In the shadow of global intent,  
26 voices rise in concert,  
pledging armor beneath a Paris sky.  
Nations cast in the mold of resolve,  
etch promises into the quiet air—  
a symphony of intentions  
for a land draped in the fragility of hope.  
Here, the word  
becomes a watchtower.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Macron says ‘Coalition of the Willing’ will finalise ‘robust’ Ukrainian security guarantees – as it happened 4.25pm BST Closing summary … and on that note, it’s a wrap! The leaders of the Coalition of the Willing have finalised a plan for potential security guarantees for Ukraine, with 26 countries declaring readiness to get directly involved, French president Emmanuel Macron said after a meeting of the Coalition of the Willing in Paris (16:25). The plan will". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
